meanings.sent1: After fixing the broken lock, remember to relock the door.
meanings.sent2: She always double-checks to make sure she relocks the front door before leaving the house.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful wizard had to relock the enchanted chest to keep the mischievous pixies out.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to relock itself, guarding against any more emotional pain.
meanings.sent5: The old treasure chest refused to relock, revealing its long-hidden contents.

meanings.sent1: Please relock the gate after you enter to keep the dog from running away.
meanings.sent2: The hiker had to relock the backpack to prevent any items from falling out.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to relock the bird feeder, much to the frustration of the hungry birds.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a key that could relock any doubts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse could only be broken if someone could relock the magical amulet.
